meanings.definition: The state or quality of being atomic.
meanings.sent1: The atomicity of the molecule made it stable.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the atomicity of elements in chemistry.
meanings.sent3: The atomicity of the situation was so clear, it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The atomicity of the family bond was unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The atomicity of the tiny particles was fascinating to observe.

meanings.definition: The property of an operation in a database management system that guarantees that either all of the tasks of the operation are performed or none of them are.
meanings.sent1: The database system's atomicity ensured data integrity.
meanings.sent2: Programmers rely on atomicity to maintain database consistency.
meanings.sent3: The atomicity of the database operation was so strict, it felt like a game.
meanings.sent4: The atomicity of the system's transactions was like a perfectly choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The atomicity of the database operation was crucial for error prevention.
